# Chris Hughes

I lead AI teams at Microsoft, helping large organisations close the gap between what they want AI to do and what actually ships. That gap—and why projects stall there—is what I think about most.

I write about applied AI, software architecture, and the discipline of building things that work. On the technical side, I enjoy understanding how things actually work—I learn by building and running experiments.

Outside of work: guitar, rock and blues, and the gym.

Views are my own.
